entry.title: NSG integration
entry.content:
We are excited to report that we are working with Neuroscience Gateway - a portal for computational Neuroscience - to perform computations on their HPC supercomputer.

When the integration is complete our users will be able to benefit from supercomputer resources in the cloud!
entry.summary: We are excited to report that we are working with Neuroscience Gateway - a portal for computational Neuroscience - to perform computations on their HPC supercomputer.

entry.title: BRAINCELL released
entry.content:
BRAINCELL is our new simulation environment which adds a lot of functionality to popular NEURON software. It is available on BRAINCELL@GitHub.

Its documentation is avaiable here too.
entry.summary: BRAINCELL is our new simulation environment which adds a lot of functionality to popular NEURON software. It is available on BRAINCELL@GitHub.

entry.title: Arachne 2.0
entry.content:
ARACHNE is a newly designed simulation environment in which neural and neuroglial network organisation, optimisation and execution take advantage of the preset, optimised parallel algorithms for remote computations, and of a friendly user interface located on a local computer.

The key advantage of ARACHNE is that it enables creation and operation of complex neuronal-astroglial networks, with a simple and intuitive GUI, by neuroscientists unfamiliar with complex programming and computational environment.
entry.summary: ARACHNE is a newly designed simulation environment in which neural and neuroglial network organisation, optimisation and execution take advantage of the preset, optimised parallel algorithms for remote computations, and of a friendly user interface located on a local computer.

entry.title: Astro 2.0
entry.content:
ASTRO 2.0. Interactive realistic model of protoplasmic astrocyte.

The simulation tool ASTRO helps to evaluate the multi-scale morphology of astroglia and to create a realistic, multi-compartmental biophysical model of an astrocyte that could be explored using NEURON computational environment.

Running Astro requires:

  1. Host computer with MATLAB (2012 version or later).
  2. NEURON (7.2 or later) under Windows 7 or Windows 10.
  3. Fast internet connections to work with GUI on Amazon cloud.
  4. Putty: a free SSH and Telnet client.
  5. Xming X Server for Windows.
entry.summary: ASTRO 2.0. Interactive realistic model of protoplasmic astrocyte.

entry.title: Amazon integration
entry.content:
What’s new since 1.0 versions (12/11/2019):

  1. The user now can operate with Amazon Web Service (AWS)
  2. Introduce a new GUI (Xming) for working with a remote Amazon cluster.
  3. Improved performance of ARACHNE for massive neural networks (over 50,000 neurons) and Astro for astrocytes with complex geometry, equipped with detailed biophysical mechanisms.
  4. Support user-defined platforms array in the definition of the ARACHNE parameter.
  5. Plus assorted bug fixes and improvements.

entry.title: Neuroalgebra founded
entry.content: Neuroalgebra Ltd was registered on 26 September 2016 in England UK, Reg. No. 10395354
entry.summary: Neuroalgebra Ltd was registered on 26 September 2016 in England UK, Reg. No. 10395354
